metadata.title: CVE-2024-35963 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: hci_sock: Fix not validating setsockopt user input Check userinput length before copying data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
